articles.title: Halt to crackdown upon KCTU demanded
articles.content:
Halt to crackdown upon KCTU demanded 
    Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- The South Korean Confederation of Trade Unions (KCTU) held a rally demanding a halt to the crackdown upon the KCTU in Seoul yesterday with at least 14,000 unionists attending, according to Seoul-based Radio No. 1.
 At the rally the organization demanded the authorities withdraw the order to arrest KCTU chairman Tan Pyong Ho if the issue of their confrontation with workers is to be settled.   
 It also strongly urged the authorities to release the arrested workers, halt the campaign to nab workers and provide the irregular workers with regular jobs.

articles.title: Greetings to Egyptian President
articles.content:
Greetings to Egyptian President 
    Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, President of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, yesterday sent a message of greetings to Egyptian President Mohamed Hosni Mubarak on the occasion of the 49th anniversary of the July 23 revolution, the national holiday of the Egyptian people.
 The message warmly congratulated the president, government and people of Egypt on this occasion.    
 It expressed belief that the traditional relations of friendship and cooperation between the two countries would grow stronger and sincerely wished the friendly Egyptian people progress and prosperity.

articles.title: U.S. urged to drop policy of confrontation
Abrogation of S. Korea-Japan "fisheries agreement" called for
articles.content:
Abrogation of S. Korea-Japan "fisheries agreement" called for 
    Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- The "National Federation of Fishermen" and other fishermen's organizations in South Korea held a rally of 500 fishermen in Pusan and began a signature campaign for abrogation of the shackling South Korea-Japan "fisheries agreement", according to a foreign news report.
 The participants said that in the "agreement" Japan and South Korea designated the fishing ground around Tok islet as tentative waters for joint fishing. they branded this as the Japanese government's political intrigue hatched up at a time when South Korea was in a political and economic confusion.

articles.title: Punishment of U.S. criminals called for
articles.content:
Punishment of U.S. criminals called for 
    Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- The Bulgarian group for the study of the Juche idea issued a statement on July 11 as regards the Korea War crimes tribunal on GIs' mass killings of civilians during the 1950-1953 Korean War held in New York.
 The statement expressed support to the judgement of the tribunal on the crimes against humanity including the U.S. mass killings of innocent people committed since its occupation of South Korea in 1945.    
 The world progressives are satisfied at this fair judgement, it noted, adding that the u.s. criminals who ruthlessly killed millions of innocent Korean people should be legally punished  by a fair international fair court as groups of Hitler and Tojo were.

articles.title: Rodong Sinmun calls on all Koreans to display patriotism
DPRK-China plan for cultural exchange signed
articles.content:
DPRK-China plan for cultural exchange signed 
    Pyongyang, July 23 (KCNA) -- A DPRK-China inter-governmental plan for cultural exchange for Juche 90-91 (2001-2002) was signed here today.
 It was signed by Hong Son Ok, vice-chairperson of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and Wang Guozhang, Chinese ambassador to the DPRK.
